result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court with Defendant Robin John Peterson. INCLUDES:  22CF548 (PH) and 22TR2452 (Intake). Court calls 22CF548: S/T Officer Nathaniel Behnke, NRPD; direct by Atty Rockow. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Chapman. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Rockow states Information will mirror the Complaint. Atty Chapman states DE would like to proceed to ARGN. Court. As to both matters, Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG in both  22CF548 and 22TR2452  Court extends timing for substitution 10 days.  Waives speedy trial. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues. Adjourned: 11:28 am
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Settlement conference on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:38 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Robin John Peterson in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Robin John Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF548 and 22TR2452. Atty Chapman requests Prelim. Court sets Prelim. DE confirms address.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Filed by ADA Rockow. arc  e: Atty Chapman.

DE qualifies for public defender but has not heard from them. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits. Court sets PSC. Court advises DE to contact PD's office. Adjourned: 10:24 AM. kma

The original document was titled: Pretrial assessment.
The original history event date is: 08-10-2022

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:22 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Ali Casey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court. Defendant Robin John Peterson appeared by video, in custody. Includes 22CF548 and 2TR2452. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Waives prelim time limits. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:24 PM
